org.ietf.nea.pt.socket.simple

Class DefaultSocketWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ietf.nea.pt.socket.simple.DefaultSocketWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SocketHandler, SocketMessenger, SocketWrapper

    public class DefaultSocketWrapper
extends Object
implements SocketWrapper
    Wrapper to encapsulate a socket and mask its functions for the transmission and receipt of TNC messages thru the contained socket and for the management of the contained socket.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultSocketWrapper

        public DefaultSocketWrapper(long maxMessageLength,
                    Socket socket,
                    TransportWriter<TransportMessage> writer,
                    TransportReader<TransportMessage> reader)
        Creates a wrapper around the given socket using the provided attributes.
        Parameters:
        maxMessageLength - the maximum supported message length of the transport connection
        socket - the socket to wrap
        writer - the writer to encode a transport message as byte stream for transmission
        reader - the reader to decode a byte stream into a transport message after reception

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Description copied from interface: SocketHandler
        Checks if the contained socket is open.
        Specified by:
        isOpen in interface SocketHandler
        Returns:
        true if socket is open and data can be written/read, false if socket is closed.

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: SocketHandler
        Closes the socket. No further data can be send. Socket cannot be reopened.
        Specified by:

      • getIdentifier

        public long getIdentifier()
        Description copied from interface: SocketMessenger
        Returns a linear growing identifier for a transport message. If the identifier reaches a value >= 4294967295 it restarts at zero.
        Specified by:
        getIdentifier in interface SocketMessenger
        Returns:
        the growing identifier
